item.title: SSH Legacy Key Exchange
item.description: SSH Legacy Key Exchange Algorithm1 When an SSH client connects to a server, each side offers sets of connection parameters to the other. For a successful connection, there must be at least one mutually compatible set for each parameter. If the client and the server cannot agree on a mutual set, in this case, the key exchange algorithm, the connection will fail and OpenSSH will return an error message like this:
